intro: Alyssum wulfenianum subsp. ovirense, commonly known as the woolly alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
